fields.summary: Studio: iOS SDK home not found and NullPointerException

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi guys,
serious problem here - after update to SDK 7.0GA and Studio to 5.0GA multiple errors shows up(java.lang.NullPointerException) regarding to no Xcode installation(I have Xcode 9.2 installed).
Everything worked fine before update.
When I click on Preferences-Platforms-iOS another null pointer error show up(Loading certificates).
Please look at it ASAP, I can't work on my any iOS projects.
Thanks

edit: Null Pointer Exceptions come out while I do many actions, i.e Refresh devices, on login, on iOS platform configuration. I can't even run Android app after update(there is no Run option, only Package). 
appc ti info -t ios doesn't show any error, everything is configured normally

comments.body: [~max87] This looks to be a duplicate of AC-5436, could you provide the information in my comment on that ticket and I'll close this as a dupe to minimise noise. Thanks!
